intro: Tephroseris papposa var. subcapitata, commonly known as the narrow-headed tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of small yellow flowers. This variety is noted for its compact growth habit and is often found in open, disturbed habitats.
